reviews.review_msg: You'll do well if you do his problem solvings, experTA and samples. He helps in office hours.
Yeah just avoid him
Great guy and good father, awful teacher.
hes a great prof and a great guy
If  ur an international student,do not take his course,and you should learn all the things by youself before tests,his class offer 0 help,and moody,that's the best word to describe peter.
Just another narcissist
He gets very moody and very demanding. One of the worst courses/professor pairings I have ever had.
Yes he is funny but it wont make course any easy with him. Just do yourself favor and avoid him.
Wish he was more passionate in teaching, not half baked interest and attitude towards students in physics
I'll make it 40 (1 star) reviews with this one. He is very moody and the best father in the world, which also makes him take his job as a joke.
Definitely my worst nightmare going taking his class

I'd say he's a funny person, great dad. But as a professor the method he teach might not be for everyone, you HAVE TO READ and UNDERSTAND the textbook and that is. Don't rely on what he teach in class it way different in the exam. You have to pass all the midterms, do all the class assignment and homework and finish his final project.
BEST PROFESSOR AT FIC. DON'T BELIEVE THE OTHER REVIEWS. HE IS AN AMAZING PERSON.
He is a kind and hilarious teacher. I like his teaching method as well. Don't be cheated by the mark he got here!

Even though this is a studio class so its expected that you should know the basics for some of the topics, the problem is that the textbook he instructs us to read is a level above our current knowledge. The questions on ExpertTA is based on the content in the textbook. Some of the questions are impossible to solve unless you took MATH152

I really like him but I'd be lying if I were to say my 3 mental breakdowns arent because of this class.
If you are a student in his class, prepare to: study independently of the classes, utilise peer education, and help each other.
An usually lecturers from 10 to 1, he sort of breaks it from 10 to 7 - 5.
Studying the quizzes is a good method too.
Many people complain about Peter but I sincerely believe that in general they have not seen that physics is always a intensive course and requires discipline. Not everything is rosy.

This dude is not cool at all y'all. He doesn't teach anything and expects you to be Einstein or Newton or sth. You must do everything by yourself and you'll lose interest in Physics after taking his course.
he's better now, do the experiments in class these days and do well in practical midterm and you should find it easy to pass
He spent most of the classes explaining how to derive the equation rather than explaining how it is related to the topic
His lecture are too complicated if you don't listen to his lectures.
DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!
Not recommended. Instead of instructing, he is attempting to prove the formula. Be prepared to check everything on moodle yourself before the lesson and to have a thorough understanding of physics.
he is a nice person, yet not a nice professor, won't recommend to others

For future students: Peter assumes you did preview before class.Take notes and Flipit questions before class Include flipit homework. Exam contains activities in class,flipit and sample exams. Practice them couple times until they show up in your dream. Exceptions are unacceptable(Late homework etc).
He is easy-going when students follow his rule.

Peter Smith is an OK professor overall, his lectures are no other than explain how is a formula formed and never do test like question in class. They are reserved for the homework in which we never receive feedback or and answer key. He likes to do jokes. Though outside class he is pretty nice.
Take it with some other professor, if you can.

He does not teach well, he gives too many breaks during class, everytime his son cries he gives a break, he does not answer questions, he does not replies to emails, does not solve any problem  in class, he puts us in breakout rooms to do assignments but he does not give clear directions, he has not graded any of my quizzes and we are almost finish
NOT GOOD PROFESSOR . DID ALL ON MY OWN TO SCORE GRADES. NO CREDIT TO HIM.

He might be a good person but he definitely not a good instructor. His lecture is clueless and his hw is even harder than mit hw. In the lab he would gather you around and tell you guys something then he hope everyone will remember it he doesn't even want to build the circuit he shouldn't teach physics honestly
he opened breakout rooms every lesson for us to discuss questions in groups, he didn't teach anything and expected us to know everything.

Very boring class, doesn't teach well. First time taking physics, but it felt pretty difficult and I was unable to understand anything in class, so if you're confident in self-studying you can try this course. He doesn't seem very friendly either- there have been some occasions where he yelled/ was rude to students in my class. Wouldn't recommend.

This professor is so bad. He never teaches us anything during class, and never does any exersices with us but expects us to be able to do them in. the midterms. Everytime he starts talking all he does is confuse us even more. I had to learn all the topics by myself and I know of others who had to do the same. If you can, avoid taking PHYS with him.
Just no, don't take him. He kills every joy you have for physics.
The professor gives a tough time for students. He barely teaches in lectures and makes his lectures way too long to the point where no information from the lectures were used in the assessments.

Literally the worst proff in all of BC. gave us an extreme hard midterm, then did an hour lab and then gave us a quiz all in the same day. I have no time for my other subjects! His lectures are useless since nothing from them ever ends up on the exams. AVOID AT ALL COST if you are actually interested in physics. He killed my love for physics
GOOD LUCK to whoever gets the pleasure of being taught by him. Basically learner all the material myself, just glad my tuition money is getting put good use.
If you want your life to be easy, avoid him like plague. Plus he will make your personal life difficult with too much homework. Quizzes will also pop out of nowhere.

If you get him in an online class good luck, he doesn't teach the physics himself and basically only does activities in class (which often don't relate to the physics that you have to learn on your own through FlipItPhysics) No actual lectures happened in this class so if you can't learn on your own good luck...

If you can choose any other professor by any chance, DO NOT CHOOSE HIM. You can complete this course without him if you choose him. He barely teaches anything in the class and explains nothing clearly. Worst professor you could ever met. Try praying to every god you know if you take his course, cause its much more useful than his lecture anyway.
Congratulations if you have him as your instructor, especially to those who have to take PHYS courses.
This teacher is not bad, and he gave students lots of free time to study by themselves, and if students pay attention during classes, he will let you pass.
Good thing is hes funny. Thats the only thing I can leave with positive feedback
Well Be sure that u are a good self-learner cuz 99% of the time he is jist sitting or ghosted, if u wanna ask sth he is ususlly short tempered So, i wont say good luck ,it wont help
He has a short-tempered. Once I messed up my project and asked him how to solve it. He didn't answer and yell at me for no reason.
Stressful classes and students are expected to solve problems that haven't been explained.

Doesn't teaches anything and expects you to learn by yourself. Treats university students like high school students. Expects you to buy book (which needs to be new, not used) and other materials which cost a lot. Thinks he is funny with his jokes but he is actually not.
Doesn't really teach the course syllabus and expects you to learn everything on your own.

Professor expects you to learn the course yourself, through all the textbooks you have to buy. Online reading and homework, lots of class work, 1% of the time professor teaching. Biggest problem is that he is the only professor for the course.
I dont like him for sure
too much work and just waste my time on the boring experiments
He is the worst teacher in the world
I just want to say he is really bad
He reuqired us using the new books that will be more than 300$ and as for his teaching, he just in his office and let us read the book without teaching. I wont take his cource agian his really suck.
He is my favourite prof forever.  He is funny , so make class very interesting .  Very enjoy his class.  If u don't want ur life boring,  Just take his courses.
He's a pretty good professor, nicely and funny, always enjoy his classes.
Don't give a clear mission to student
Hilarious, always looked forward to his classes. A pretty good professor, gets along very nicely. Would love to do it again.
Awesome prof. Very good and entertaining plus is a lenient marker. Cracks jokes and loves Breaking Bad and The Wire which BTW are both awesome tv series.
Excellent prof

Excellent prof. He showed a great interest in this course. Assignment is very easy, marking is fair. He explained very things so clearly and exam is absolutely doable. Take his course if you want to boost your GPA.
Great Guy. Great at marking. Gives you clues to the answers rather than telling you exactly what it is. Looking forward to take another course with him!

i have not  seen a bad prof like him.he sometimes put his emotion in the class, when he was happy, he may help you with Qs, if not, he may just dont answer it and ask you to figure it out yourself. try not to take his class by all means.
OK prof. but does not help much.Transparency is quite low and you always have a fear of getting bad grades.
no comments

He's an okay prof, although I really learned more by reading the textbook than from him, to be honest.  Like others have said, he has some difficulty with clarity and most of his notes are just directly from the textbook.  His paragraph-format notes make it hard to concentrate too.  Attendance = Must due to iClicker questions.

He is a very very very bad teacher. The course is not that hard, but he makes it like a 300 level course. And his office hr is useless at all. People do not like to go to his office hrs. Because all the TAs have better ability to explain the Qs that you ask.

He is good at explaining things one-on-one and definitely has an interest in physics; however, teaching is not his strong point. Homework is due before he teaches it which means you teach yourself. It felt like a correspondence course.

Funny, cool guy, only helpful one to one. Other than that he is a horrible prof. He takes notes from the textbook and complicates it more and is very poor in explaining the simplest concepts. Unless you are able to teach yourself the concepts it is hard to do good on the exams and have a good understanding of the course. Do not recommend him

He's a joke. Has a lot of trouble answering basic questions, constantly gets flustered during lecture and is always making mistakes and erasing large parts of the notes he's just made (which are all copied directly out of the textbook btw) A little bit more helpful one on one, but I'd avoid this guy.

Cool guy, but as a professor, needs to be more clear when explaining concepts. Found that he like to throw out and break down formulas to try and answer your question. Know your formulas and you should be fine! Very helpful during office hours.
He is good and provides formula sheets for mid and final. A lot of assignment to do.
very humorous. much homework to do
Has a hard time explaining the concepts and fumbles around when students ask basic questions. Has a really difficult time clarifying even the most basic of concepts.
He's absolutely useless. He copies everything straight from the text, but doesn't explain it properly. You're better off skipping his lectures and just reading all  of the text book.
